Notes: Modified 5th-gen with indigenous Elbit C4I suite, AN/APG-81 AESA radar (200+ km detection), and internal 4-6 AIM-120D/Rampage bays for stealthy BVR; sensor fusion and MADL/Link-16 enable cooperative kills with G550 CAEW cueing to 200 km envelope; 75 operational across 4 squadrons (e.g., 140th at Hatzerim), with 25 more on order toward 100 total.

Heavy 4.5-gen with AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA (250 km range), conformal tanks, and 10+ AIM-120D/Rampage pylons for long-range BVR; Bedek upgrades (2025) add EW fusion; No. 69 Squadron at Hatzerim, excels in lofted launches with 200 km effective via sat-links.

Block 52+ with Elta EL/M-2032 AESA (200 km), fly-by-wire, and 8 AIM-120D loads for agile BVR; Spice 1000 integration for stand-off; 102 across 3 squadrons (e.g., 101st at Ramon), core for networked 180 km engagements with Green Pine cueing.

Upgraded Block 40/52 with IAI Elta radar (150 km) and 6-8 AIM-120D pylons for high-volume BVR; Barak 2020 mods (complete 2025) enhance ECCM/datalink; 102 operational (e.g., 133rd at Ramon), sustains surge ops integrated with F-35I.

Upgraded with AN/APG-70 radar (200 km) and 8 AIM-120C-7 loads for intercept/BVR; Baz Meshupaz refit (2025) adds conformal tanks; ~25 across 2 squadrons (e.g., 133rd at Tel Nof), reliable for QRA with 160 km envelope via CAEW.

CAEW with EL/I-2085 AESA radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120 updates; 103rd Squadron at Nevatim, critical kill-chain enabler (2 more ordered 2024) for F-35/F-15 salvos to 200 km.
Converted KC-707 with boom refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-15/F-16; 120th Squadron at Lod, enables sustained patrols (retiring by 2028 for KC-46); integrates with CAEW for persistent ops.
ELINT platform with EL/I-3001 suite (300 km sensors) for enemy radar cueing/jamming; supports BVR by degrading IADS; 122nd Squadron at Nevatim, enhances multi-domain fusion with F-35 datalinks.
